meanings.definition: The status of a church or group of churches that is self-governing and independent.
meanings.sent1: The autocephaly of the church allowed it to make decisions independently.
meanings.sent2: The autocephaly of the churches in the region led to diverse practices.
meanings.sent3: The autocephaly of the church made it the boss of its own decisions.
meanings.sent4: In the world of churches, autocephaly is like being the captain of your own ship.
meanings.sent5: The concept of autocephaly can be compared to a country having its own government.

meanings.definition: The condition of being self-headed or having its own leader.
meanings.sent1: The autocephaly of the organization allowed it to choose its own leader.
meanings.sent2: The team's autocephaly meant they could elect their own captain.
meanings.sent3: The autocephaly of the group made it the chief of its own decisions.
meanings.sent4: In a group setting, autocephaly is like having a leader who calls the shots.
meanings.sent5: Understanding autocephaly is like knowing who is in charge in a group.
